results.title: Life with junior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A typical day in the life of a ten-year-old, presenting such common problems as the acceptance of a new brother and the refusal to eat. Emphasises the anxieties of parents over guiding their children in today’s world, and explains ways in which to cope with behaviour problems.

results.title: Life with grandpa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
The problems of old age as they affect people in the United States - achievements of medical science in forestalling disease, controlling dangerous ailments earlier in life; with a longer life expectancy, an increasing population of old people; ways of combating prejudices against employing old persons. Some notable personalities of advanced years including Sir Winston Churchill, Dorothy Dix and George Bernard Shaw.

results.title: Life with baby
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
How children grow mentally and physically has been studied during the past 35 years by a group of specialists working under the direction of Dr Arnold Gesell at the Yale University Clinic of Child Development. They have been able to establish definite standards of development for children up to six years of age. Many of these findings are illustrated in this film. Non-technical in character, the film aims at a better understanding of the young child by adults and older children.

results.title: Life will never be the same
results.creator_credit: Amanda Jurisic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘You don’t need to jump on a plane, or go to a theme park or stay at a five star hotel to experience the beautiful things in life.’ Amanda Jurisic remembers her father’s legacy : a sense of adventure and a love of travel. The values he taught her have stayed with her, and inspired her to travel the world.

results.title: Life times nine
results.creator_credit: Insight Productions (US), Pen Densham and John Watson
results.brief_description: An anthology of nine short films, each written and directed by a student (youngest 11 - oldest 15). Each film is a commercial for life, to promote appreciation of being alive. The films in the anthology are BIRD (directed and written by Kimmie Jensen); LIFE, LIFE, LIFE (directed and written by Jordon Hale); TANK (directed and written by Paul Shapiro); GHOSTS (directed and written by Marilyn Becker); PEANUT (directed and written by Ricky Clark); CHESSMEN (directed and written by Melissa Franklin); OLD FOLKS (directed and written by Robi Blumenstein); GROWING UP (directed and written by Celia Merkur) and MUD PUDDLE (directed and written by Andrew File).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Insight Productions (US), Pen Densham and John Watson

results.title: Life story of the paramecium
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: The physical characteristics, life functions, adaptation to environment and means of reproduction of the paramecium, a one-celled animal or protozoa which performs all life functions in a single cell. Some, the volvox, live in colonies and perform special functions, making it possible for new organisms to develop and function. An understanding of the protozoa provides the basis for a better understanding of the functions of all animals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork

results.title: Life story of the oyster
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Oysters belong to the mollusc family - two irregularly shaped shells protect the oyster’s soft body. The interior of the shell is lined with smooth white mother of pearl. We see how increased demands and modern sea farming methods have greatly increased the number of oysters being harvested annually. America imports “seed” oysters from Japan to increase production.

results.title: Life story
results.creator_credit: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Joel Atkinson’s parents split up, his dad took him to Shepparton. Determined to make the most of it, Atkinson worked hard to be a good role model for his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
